results.title: Will you join?
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Union Representative”.
A new man starts work in a warehouse and is immediately approached by the union representative and told that it is in his best interests to join the Union. This approach offends the new man and he decides to seek another job. This film is an examination of the union delegate’s role and his manner in recruiting members.

results.title: Changes in the office
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Union Representative”.
The female union representative approaches a company manager to find out whether or not automated office equipment is to be installed which will cause fifty percent of the staff to be made redundant. Focuses on the manner in which the union delegate approaches the manager and how well she fulfils her role in representing the staff. Suitable for tertiary level.

results.title: A Personal matter
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Don Murray, Australian Council for Union Training and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Union Representative”.
A migrant worker in a factory needs time off to take his sick wife to hospital, but the union representative does not see this as a sufficiently important matter for him to deal with. Raises the question of prejudices and principles of justice and fair play in relation to the union’s responsibility to the individual worker.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Keith Gow, Don Murray, Australian Council for Union Training and Film Australia

results.title: Report
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Union Communication”.
Indication of the dangers faced by employees jumping to incorrect conclusions based on second-hand and unreliable information from the Union delegate about management’s intentions.

results.title: Facts
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Union Communication”.
A change in working hours upsets the workers at a factory and Dixon, the Union delegate, is asked to report the change to the union office. In his report to the organiser, Dixon manages to bring in all sorts of irrelevancies but is very short on accurate information. This film manages to pinpoint an area of possible confusion if union delegates fail to get the facts straight.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Keith Gow, Don Murray and Film Australia

results.title: Interview
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Union Communication”
A factory worker complains to his union delegate when he is required to work overtime at short notice. The film pinpoints the need for the delegate to calm down the union member and sort out the facts before he can discuss the incident with management.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Keith Gow, Don Murray and Film Australia

results.title: Rocks and minerals. - Rev. ed.
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Understanding Our Earth”.
Provides clear description of how the various types of igneous, sedimentary and metamorphic rocks are formed. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
